name: TypingMind
description: TypingMind provides a professional UI to interact with multiple AI language models for enhanced chat experiences.
longDescription: TypingMind is a web-based platform designed to enhance user interactions with large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini by offering a clean, intuitive interface and advanced features. It allows users to connect their own API keys to access various AI models, paying only for usage directly to the model providers. The platform supports both individual and team use, with options for self-hosting and custom-built solutions for businesses. Its mission is to streamline workflows, improve productivity, and provide tailored AI responses through features like chat management, prompt libraries, and plugins. TypingMind stands out for its flexibility, regular updates, and ability to integrate with multiple AI providers, making it a versatile tool for professionals and teams. It also offers a self-hosted version for enhanced privacy and local deployment.
features: Supports multiple AI models like GPT-4, Claude, and Gemini, allowing users to choose the best model for their needs.
Provides a prompt library with over 200 built-in prompts and AI agents to streamline task-specific interactions.
Enables chat management with folders, search, pinning, and bulk deletion for organized conversations.
Offers plugins for web search, image generation, and chart rendering to extend AI functionality.
Allows self-hosting on local devices or private servers for enhanced privacy and availability.
Facilitates team collaboration with a bulk license for up to 10 users and a custom AI chat portal for businesses.
Includes cloud sync for seamless access across multiple devices.
Supports custom model integration with user-defined endpoints and parameters for advanced users.
Provides text-to-speech and language control features for improved accessibility and usability.
Enables document upload for AI to summarize or answer questions based on user-provided content.
Offers a one-time purchase option for premium features, avoiding recurring subscription costs.

faqs.question: What AI models does TypingMind support?
faqs.answer: TypingMind supports models like GPT-4, Claude, Gemini, and other LLMs, accessible via user-provided API keys.

faqs.question: Is a ChatGPT Plus subscription required to use TypingMind?
faqs.answer: No, TypingMind requires an OpenAI API key with a paid account, separate from a ChatGPT Plus subscription.

faqs.question: Can I use TypingMind for free?
faqs.answer: Yes, TypingMind offers a free plan with basic features, but advanced features require a license key purchase.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of self-hosting TypingMind?
faqs.answer: Self-hosting allows users to run TypingMind on private servers or local devices for enhanced privacy and availability.

faqs.question: How does TypingMind handle team collaboration?
faqs.answer: TypingMind offers a bulk license for up to 10 users and a custom AI chat portal for team management.

faqs.question: Can TypingMind generate images or access the internet?
faqs.answer: Yes, with plugins, TypingMind supports image generation via DALL-E and web search for up-to-date information.

faqs.question: How do I set up TypingMind with my API keys?
faqs.answer: Users can input API keys from providers like OpenAI or Anthropic in the Profile section to start using models.

faqs.question: What are the limitations of the free plan?
faqs.answer: The free plan lacks advanced features like plugins, AI agents, and full chat management, which require a license key.
